input: dCSL vs stochastic Schroedinger analogues for finite energy.
output: Both add noise; dCSL imposes dissipation yielding finite asymptotic energy [1], whereas stochastic Schroedinger analogues emphasize explicit band-limited S(I%) shaping [2].

input: Contrast the Ford-Roman quantum inequality with the warp ledger Casimir tile guardrail.
output: [CITATION: /documents/papers/ford-roman-qi-1995.md#inequality] The Ford-Roman QI limits how long negative energy persists; [CITATION: /documents/alcubierre-alignment.md#guardrails] the tile guardrail caps duty and plate spacing so the ledger never demands that forbidden flux.
